page.title: 20DEVELOPMENT OF SPAXTON.
page.content: From 1555 to 1893 the parish was responsible for the maintenance of the roads and highways. The woollen trade was active in the village in the 15th century. At one time there were 5 working mills. Records show that in 1889 there was in the village{1 Assistant Overseer,3 {Blacksmiths,1 Baker,3Carpenters,2 {Cowkeepers,2 Dressmakers,1 Dairyman,1 {Draper,5 Grocers,1 Limeburner,3 {Millers,1 Wheelwright,1 {Poultrydealer,1 Stonemason,1 Gelder {and Sheepdipper,1 Timbermerchant,5 {Public Houses,1 Butcher,5 Boot and {Shoemakers. { }Mains Water came in early 1930. Electricity in 1950. Little expansion of the village by building development due to lack of main drainage. Mains drainage completed in 1985.
